results.title: Relationship Between Calcium Channel Blockers Therapy and Cognitive Function Improvement in Cognitive Decline Patients with Cerebrovascular Disease.
results.text_hl: AIM: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of 24 weeks of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@S-amlodipine besylate@@@ therapy on cognitive function in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@cerebrovascular disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Jeong HT, Sung HH, Lee JH, Park KY, Youn YC. Relationship Between Calcium Channel Blockers Therapy and Cognitive Function Improvement in Cognitive Decline Patients with Cerebrovascular Disease. High Blood Press Cardiovasc Prev. 2022 Nov;29(6):595-600. PMID: 36166186

results.title: Effect of long-term antihypertensive treatment on cerebrovascular structure and function in hypertensive rats
results.text_hl: Both drugs lowered blood pressure equally, while only @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ decreased heart rate. @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@Cerebrovascular resistance@@@ was increased in SHR, which was prevented by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ but not @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Naessens DMP, de Vos J, Richard E, Wilhelmus MMM, Jongenelen CAM, Scholl ER, van der Wel NN, Heijst JA, Teunissen CE, Strijkers GJ, Coolen BF, VanBavel E, Bakker ENTP. Effect of long-term antihypertensive treatment on cerebrovascular structure and function in hypertensive rats Sci Rep. 2023 Mar 1;13(1):3481. PMID: 36859481

results.title: Effects of atorvastatin, amlodipine, and their combination on vascular dysfunction in insulin-resistant rats.
results.text_hl: Effects of @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and their combination on @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@vascular dysfunction@@@ in insulin-resistant @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Effects of telmisartan or amlodipine monotherapy versus telmisartan/amlodipine combination therapy on vascular dysfunction and oxidative stress in diabetic rats.
results.text_hl: Effects of @CHEMICAL_Telmisartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077333 @@@telmisartan@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ monotherapy versus @CHEMICAL_Telmisartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077333 @@@telmisartan@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ combination therapy on @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@vascular dysfunction@@@ and oxidative stress in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: The effects of amlodipine on cerebral circulatory values in patients with essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ along with the reduction in systemic blood pressure caused attenuation of @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@cerebrovascular abnormalities@@@: decrease in @DISEASE_Muscle_Spasticity @DISEASE_MESH:D009128 @@@spastic@@@ signs and increase in cerebral blood supply in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Alizade IG, Karayeva NT. The effects of amlodipine on cerebral circulatory values in patients with essential hypertension. Anadolu Kardiyol Derg. 2001 Mar;1(1):14-6. PMID: 12122965

results.title: Comparison of the anti-hypertensive effects of the L/N-type calcium channel antagonist cilnidipine, and the L-type calcium channel antagonist amlodipine in hypertensive patients with cerebrovascular disease.
results.text_hl: In the @CHEMICAL_cilnidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C065927 @@@cilnidipine@@@ groups, no difference in average 24-hour or waking systolic blood pressure values was seen between @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@cerebrovascular disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@CVD@@@) subjects and non-@<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@CVD@@@ subjects, although in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ groups, @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@CVD@@@ subjects had significantly higher blood pressure values than non-@<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@CVD@@@ subjects.

citations.NLM: Takei K, Araki N, Ohkubo T, Tamura N, Yamamoto T, Furuya D, Yanagisawa CT, Shimazu K. Comparison of the anti-hypertensive effects of the L/N-type calcium channel antagonist cilnidipine, and the L-type calcium channel antagonist amlodipine in hypertensive patients with cerebrovascular disease. Intern Med. 2009;48(16):1357-61. PMID: 19687579

results.title: Optimal Combination of Effective ANtihypertensives (OCEAN) study: a prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded endpoint trial--rationale, design and results of a pilot study in Japan.
results.text_hl: Two hundred and sixty-six @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (mean age: 65.9 years) were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ alone. One hundred and fifty-four of these @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (57.9%) did not reach the treatment targets (<140/90 mm Hg for the elderly and @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Cerebrovascular_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002561 @@@cerebrovascular disease@@@, <130/80 mm Hg for those with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@, @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ or prior @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@) and a second agent was added.

citations.NLM: Kageyama S, Ueda S, Mochizuki K, Miyakawa M, Sugawara M, Nakayama M, Ohashi Y, Saito I, Saruta T, OCEAN Study Group. Optimal Combination of Effective ANtihypertensives (OCEAN) study: a prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded endpoint trial--rationale, design and results of a pilot study in Japan. Hypertens Res. 2012 Feb;35(2):221-7. PMID: 22089534
